turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hi.  How are you today? How is your holiday weekend going?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Good and you?  Going to a bbq later.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Nice.  Yeah mine is going well too.  I'm just happy not to have to work today.  How about you? Are you off today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yeah been off for a couple of days. It's nice.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Nice.  You know every year around this time I try to give a little bit of money to charity, before the holidays start and I know I'm going to be broke. How about you? Do you usually give to charities?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I give from time to time, if it's a good cause

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Nice.  What kinds of charities do you usually give to, if you don't mind me asking?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I usually give to local charities that provide for the homeless.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I do as well here in Chicago. Recently though, I've started to give more to charities that have to do with children. I feel like children are often the most as risk in disasters and conflict around the world. With them even just a little bit of money goes a long way in feeding them. Have you ever donated to a children's charity?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I have donated to the McDonald house

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Nice. I remember seeing those commercials on TV.  One that I like is called Save the Children.  It's an organization that helps children in very difficult circumstances, both here in the US and around the world.  Have you heard of them before?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Sounds like a good cause.  Do you have a website?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes. It's  URL   There you will see the various projects they are working on.  For exaxmple, the work they are doing in Syria right now is incredibly important as there are unfortunately thousands upon thousands of orphans due to the war.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Looks like they also help border children in the US.  I am all for that.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes. I agree. That's also a very important endeavor.  There are just so many difficult situations out there for children.  But it's good to know at lease one organization tries to help the most in need.  Did you know that they accept donations from mturk?  So we could donate directly to them from our funds for this HIT.  Even small amounts go a long way when so many people donate.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I can donate 50 cents right now, the rest goes into my childs college fund

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Ok. That sounds great.  I'm going to donate a similar amount myself

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: sounds good, it is always worthwhile to donating something, nothing is too small

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I agree.  Especially with how many people are participating.  If everybody in America gave 1 dollar today, that would be 370 million.  It's amazing how many adds up

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Plus who doesn't want to help children?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Exactly.  Well, you take care and enjoy the rest of your holiday. It was nice chatting with you

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Nice chatting with you too.
